Posts.Content: horsrde wrote: does anyone know what "neoplastic lesion" means??  Been there done that with the breast cancer thing - three years out now.  But now they have found some growths in my overies.  The right ovary has a cyst that has grown since my last pelivc ulrasound six weeks ago............  this is what the report says if anyone know how to read this stuff.............. The right ovary contains a 4*5.3*4.0 cm cyst with a few thick septations.  This cyst has enlarged since previos exam.  The complex right ovarian cyst has developed more prominent septations and soft-tissue components. This may represent a neoplastic lesion.  Surgical removal is suggested. What do you think this means??  more bloody cancer??  anyone out there with experience with this stuff............ HELP............  trying not to freak out again!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Does anyone know.... horsrde horsrde

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2009 01:32PM - edited Feb 12, 2009 01:55PM by horsrde thanks everyone, I find it really hard not to freak out when the doctors are freaking out!  Sometimes if helps to get the plain facts from other survivors - not just the stuff from doctors. And doctors, all they seem to tell me is "we don't know",  "we don't know what is going to happen to you because you where diagnosed with b/c so young", "we don't know if you should have your ovaries removed, because we don't know what the long term effect is on some one under the age of 40 doing this" .............................. there is so many "I don't know from doctors" that I am starting to feel like a test subject- the "let's see what happens to her test"....................... sorry for venting!! But I appreciate everyone's feed back!!
Posts.Title: Does anyone know.... horsrde horsrde
